Astoria, Zohran Mamdani's working-class New York
subhead: The victory of New York City's new mayor on November 4 was also a victory for his Queens neighborhood, Astoria, which he made the focus of his campaign. This cosmopolitan district, plagued by economic difficulties, wants to be a beacon of hope in Trump's America.

headline: EU strikes deal to provide €90 billion to Ukraine
Brown University shooting suspect found dead, says police chief
In Quebec, Islam is at the heart of new debates on secularism
subhead: A new bill proposes closing prayer spaces at universities, reigniting questions about the role of religion in public spaces.

headline: 'Weaving, embroidering, sublimating': Palais Galliera in Paris spotlights an array of craftsmanship
subhead: The Paris fashion museum invites visitors to discover creations by lace-makers, embroiderers, feather artisans and other adornment specialists until October 18, 2026. These métiers d'art are essential to the prestige of major fashion houses.

headline: At the Rétrofutur Museum in Paris, looking to the past to better understand the future
subhead: Housed in a construction-site container and a venue loaned by the town hall in the 13th arrondissement of Paris, the museum shines a light on forgotten techniques and objects to highlight alternative energy sources.

headline: Pina Picierno, the Italian MEP threatened by Russia for backing Ukraine
subhead: The low-profile vice president of the European Parliament has received a torrent of death threats for months. Under police protection since June, the Italian continues her fight against pro-Russian propaganda in Europe.

'It is easier to flatter the people than to serve. Therein lies the last obstacle to an RN victory in 2027'
subhead: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

headline: A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhead: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.

headline: Minnesota's Somali community stands up to Trump: 'We are no less American than other Americans'
subhead: After the revelation of a Covid-19 relief fraud scheme involving nearly 80 individuals of Somali origin, the American president deployed immigration police within the large Somali community in Minnesota, whose members are predominantly US citizens.

headline: Sydney attack: 'Relatively spared from terrorism, Australia is therefore less prepared for it'
